sect1.title: Functions within a locale
sect1.para: Zend_Locale also provides additional informations on locales. These will be described in the following sections.

sect2.title: Serialization
sect2.para: Of course Zend_Locale provides the possibility to serialize itself, as all other locale-aware classes should do.

example.title: Serialize locales
example.programlisting:
<?php

require_once('Zend/Locale.php');

$locale = new Zend_Locale();
$serial = $locale->serialize();

// and now create the original class
$newlocale = unserialize($serial);
?>

sect2.title: Equality
sect2.para: Zend_Locale also provides an check of equality. All locale-aware classes should also provide this check.

example.title: Check for equal locales
example.programlisting:
<?php

require_once('Zend/Locale.php');

$locale = new Zend_Locale();
$mylocale = new Zend_Locale('en_US');

// Check if locales are equal
if ($locale->equals($mylocale)
    print "Locales are equal";
else
    print "Locales differ from each other";
?>

sect2.title: toString
sect2.para: Zend_Locale provides also the toString() function for the locale.

example.title: String output of locales
example.programlisting:
<?php

require_once('Zend/Locale.php');

$locale = new Zend_Locale();
print $locale->toString();
?>

sect2.para: Of course there are ways, the toString() function will be called automaticaly.

example.title: Automatic toString for locales
example.programlisting:
<?php

require_once('Zend/Locale.php');

$locale = new Zend_Locale();
print $locale;
?>

sect2.title: Default locales
sect2.para: All default locales the framework has found, can be returned by using the function getDefault(). They will be returned as array and include not only the locale but also a quality when avaiable.

There are 2 parameters... the first one defines which default should be outputted first. It can be BROWSER, SERVER and FRAMEWORK. The second parameter defines if all default locales should be returned or just the first ones.

example.title: Get default locales
example.programlisting:
<?php

require_once('Zend/Locale.php');

$locale = new Zend_Locale();

// Return all default locales
$found = $locale->getDefault();
print_r($found);

// Return only browser locales
$found2 = $locale->getDefault(Zend_Locale::BROWSER,TRUE);
print_r($found2);
?>

sect2.title: Get all environment locales
sect2.para: All set environment locales can be retrieves by using getEnvironment(). They will be returned as array.

example.title: Get environment locales
example.programlisting:
<?php

require_once('Zend/Locale.php');

$locale = new Zend_Locale();

// Return all environment locales
$found = $locale->getEnvironment();
print_r($found);
?>

sect2.title: Get all browser locales
sect2.para: As for environment locales, the same function can be found for browser locales. getBrowser() will return the information as array.

example.title: Get browser locales
example.programlisting:
<?php

require_once('Zend/Locale.php');

$locale = new Zend_Locale();

// Return all browser locales
$found = $locale->getBrowser();
print_r($found);
?>

sect2.title: Cloning a locale
sect2.para: Ofcourse the locale can be cloned with the clone keyword as every other object.

example.title: clone
example.programlisting:
<?php

require_once('Zend/Locale.php');
$locale = new Zend_Locale('ar');

// Return all browser locales
$found = $locale->toString();
$newlocale = clone $locale;

print $found . "=" . $newlocale->toString();
?>

sect2.title: Set a new locale
sect2.para: A new locale can be set with the function setLocale(). This function takes a locale string as parameter. If no locale is given, the best locale will be searched automatically.

example.title: setLocale
example.programlisting:
<?php

require_once('Zend/Locale.php');

$locale = new Zend_Locale();

// Actual locale
print $locale->toString();

// new locale
$locale->setLocale('aa_DJ');
print $locale->toString();
?>

sect2.title: Get the actual set language
sect2.para: With getLanguage() the language can be returned from the actual set locale. It will be returned as string.

example.title: getLanguage
example.programlisting:
<?php

require_once('Zend/Locale.php');

$locale = new Zend_Locale();

// Actual language
print $locale->getLanguage();
?>

sect2.title: Get the actual set region
sect2.para: With getRegion() the region can be returned from the actual set locale. It will be returned as string or, when no region is defined, as empty string.

example.title: getRegion
example.programlisting:
<?php

require_once('Zend/Locale.php');

$locale = new Zend_Locale();

// Actual region
print $locale->getRegion();
?>

sect2.title: Get an translated string of an language
sect2.para: With getLanguageDisplay() the translated languagename of the given language will be returned.

example.title: getLanguageDisplay
example.programlisting:
<?php
require_once('Zend/Locale.php');

$locale = new Zend_Locale();

// Language
print $locale->getLanguageDisplay('de');
?>

sect2.para: You want to have for each language the language written in native letters ? Well... then you should just try this example within your browser. You can just add an locale for which you want the display be returned.

example.title: All Languages written in native letters
example.programlisting:
getLanguageList(); foreach($list as $language => $content) { try { $output = $locale->getLanguageDisplay($language, $language); if (is_string($output)) { print "\n
[".$language."] ".$output; } } catch (Exception $e) { continue; } } ?>

sect2.para: As you can see the handling and receiving of information is very easy. You can do the same for all scripts or all territories for example

note.title: Be aware
note.para: The useage of a locale which does not exist, will throw an exception. As not all languages are also locales a exception would be thrown if we would not have catched it.

sect2.title: Get a list of languages
sect2.para: With getLanguageList() an array of all known languagenames translated to the actual locale's language will be returned.

example.title: getLanguageList
example.programlisting:
<?php

require_once('Zend/Locale.php');

$locale = new Zend_Locale();

// LanguageList
print_r($locale->getLanguageList());
?>

note.title: Languagelists for other locales
note.para: The same way as with the function getLanguageDisplay() this function also supports the useage for informations returned from other locales. Just use the optional locale setting as last parameter.
